DRAG DROP -
A company uses Exchange Online.
A user reports that an email from a specific sender is quarantined.
You need to review the quarantine details.
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
//IMG//

discussion.content: Answer is correct. tested it in my lab

questions.question_text:
A company uses Exchange Online. The company creates a transport rule to append a disclaimer to incoming emails from external senders.
Users report that emails from external senders do not include the disclaimer.
You need to troubleshoot the issue.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
correct

A message trace is a tool that allows you to track the progress of specific messages as they travel through the Exchange Online environment. You can use a message trace to troubleshoot issues with transport rules, such as why a disclaimer is not being appended to incoming emails from external senders.

To perform a message trace, you can use the Exchange admin center or the Exchange Online PowerShell module. Once you have performed the trace, you can review the results to see if there were any errors or issues that prevented the transport rule from applying the disclaimer.
D seems to Coorrect. You can see if it hits a Transport Rule

choices.B: The email was released from the quarantine and was sent to the intended recipients.
choices.C: The email skipped spam filtering and was delivered because the sender was in the Allowed Senders list.
choices.A: The email was marked as spam and delivered to the recipientâ€™s Junk Email folder.
choices.D: The email skipped spam filtering and was delivered because the source IP address was in the IP Allow list.

discussion.content:
This is D. The email skipped spam filtering and was delivered because the source IP address was in the IP Allow list.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/monitoring/trace-an-email-message/run-a-message-trace-and-view-results#spam-filter-agent-ssfa
SFV=SPM The message was marked as spam by the content filter.
IPV=CAL The message was allowed through the spam filters because the IP address was specified in an IP Allow list in the connection filter.

Selected Answer: D
Checked D is correct

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/monitoring/trace-an-email-message/run-a-message-trace-and-view-results#spam-filter-agent-ssfa
IPV=CAL The message was allowed through the spam filters because the IP address was specified in an IP Allow list in the connection filter.
For other message trace question you can use this site: https://blog.ahasayen.com/eop-exchange-online-protection-architecture/

discussion.content:
But if you already have the new certificate because you have requested it not by exchange powershell you will need to:
1) import it
2) get its thumbprint
3) enable it

questions.question_text:

A company has a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 hybrid environment. The Exchange server is configured to use TLS encryption for SMTP.
The TLS encryption certificate expires.
You need to install a new certificate for SMTP on the server.
Which three cmdlets should you use? To answer, move the cmdlets from the list of cmdlets to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
